meta.name: Baldur's Gate III Investigator Expansion
meta.description: An unofficial fan-made investigator expansion adapted from Larian Studios' Baldur's Gate III. Included are the Tav and companion investigators, a D&D 5e class and subclass system, enemy encounter packs, and player cards and weaknesses. Check out the Learn More link for additional rules and clarifications.
meta.author: Mint Tea Fan

cards.back_flavor: Lae'zel is a ferocious Githyanki warrior, mighty even by the standards of her mind flayer-hunting kind. Faced with transforming into the very monster she's sworn to destroy, Lae'zel must prove herself worthy of rejoining her people - if they don't execute her first.
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Guardian cards ([guardian]) level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, up to 10 other [[Talent]] cards level 0-2*. For every 10 experience you've earned in total, increase this level* by 1. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Githyanki Psionics, Hshar'lak, 1 random basic weakness.
cards.name: Lae'zel
cards.text:
[reaction] When you play a card, exhaust any number of non-permanent assets you control: Reduce that card's resource cost by 1 for each asset you exhausted in this way.
[elder_sign] effect: +1. For each point you succeed by, ready an asset you control (max 3).

cards.name: Githyanki Psionics
cards.text:
Lae'zel deck only.
Githyanki Psionics counts as 2 exhausted assets for the purposes of Lae'zel's [reaction] ability.
[reaction] After you exhaust Githyanki Psionics: Draw 2 cards. Choose 1 non-weakness card from your hand to place at the bottom of your deck.

cards.name: Hshar'lak
cards.text: Revelation - Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until an enemy is discarded. Attach Hshar'lak to that enemy and spawn it engaged with you. Forced - After you exhaust a card you control at attached enemy's location: It attacks you.

cards.back_flavor: Minthara received a tough and cruel upbringing. Born into the House Baenre of Menzoberranzan, she survived her first assassination attempt while a newborn. Years later, Minthara sought to track down an envoy of cultists who dared to intrude upon her home, only to find herself captured and forcibly indoctrinated. Now, Minthara must free herself from her puppeteers before they herald the end.
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Guardian cards ([guardian]) level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, up to 10 other [[Blessed]] and/or [[Cursed]] cards level 0-2*. For every 10 experience you've earned in total, increase this level* by 1. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Spidersilk Armor, Absolute's Will, 1 random basic weakness.
cards.name: Minthara
cards.text: Forced - At the start of the game: Name a chaos token as your "soul brand". [reaction] When an investigator reveals your soul brand: They get +1 skill value for this test and gain 1 resource. (Limit 1 resource per test.) [elder_sign] effect: +1. You get [advantage] on your next skill test.

cards.name: Spidersilk Armor
cards.text:
Minthara deck only.
[reaction] When an investigator reveals your soul brand: Heal 1 damage or 1 horror from Spidersilk Armor.
[free] Exhaust Spidersilk Armor and spend 1 resource: Choose a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location. It cannot ready this round.

cards.name: Absolute's Will
cards.text: Revelation - Put Absolute's Will into play in your threat area. Investigators at your location get [disadvantage] [disadvantage] on [willpower] tests. [action][action]: Discard Absolute's Will.

cards.back_flavor: Gale is a wizard prodigy whose love for a goddess made him attempt a dread feat no mortal should. Blighted by the forbidden magic of ancient Netheril, Gale strives to undo the corruption that is overtaking him and win back his goddess’ favour before he becomes a destroyer of worlds.
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Seeker cards ([seeker]) level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, [[Spell]] cards level 0-2*. For every 10 experience you've earned in total, increase this level* by 1. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Mystra's Chosen, Tara, Consume the Weave, 1 random basic weakness.
cards.name: Gale
cards.text:
[reaction] After you play or commit a [[Spell]] card: Discover 1 clue at your location. (Limit once per round.)
[elder_sign] effect: +0. If you succeed, search your discard pile or the top 6 cards of your deck for a [[Spell]] card and draw it. Shuffle your deck if it is searched.

cards.name: Tara
cards.text: Gale deck only. You can have up to 2 [concentration] cards in play. [reaction] When you initiate a skill test on a treachery card, exhaust Tara: That card gains the [[Spell]] trait for the duration of this skill test.

cards.name: Consume the Weave
cards.text: Revelation - Put Consume the Weave into play in your threat area. Forced - After you initiate a [intellect] test, if there are 1 or fewer cards beneath Consume the Weave: You get [disadvantage] for this test. [action]: Place a non-weakness asset from your hand or play area beneath this card.

cards.back_flavor: A legend who once thwarted a Bhaalspawn named Sarevok, Jaheira was born a noble in the nation of Tethyr. She was only a year old when a civil war broke out that killed her family. One of the servant girls took Jaheira and fled into the forest of Tethyr. There, they stumbled upon an enclave of druids who took them in and raised Jaheira as their own. As a young woman, Jaheira joined a clandestine group of do-gooders called the Harpers alongside her husband, Khalid. Now, a century later, she is once again on the trail of a sinister plot--one that seems eerily familiar.
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Seeker cards ([seeker]) level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, [[Illicit]] and/or [[Connection]] cards level 0-2*. For every 10 experience you've earned in total, increase this level* by 1. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Khalid's Gift, Bad Intel, 1 random basic weakness.
cards.name: Jaheira
cards.text:
[reaction] After an [intellect] skill test ends, if you succeeded and discovered no clues from your location during that test: Take an investigate action. (Limit once per round.)
[elder_sign] effect: +1. If you would discover clues during this test, you may discover them at a connecting location, instead.

cards.name: Khalid's Gift
cards.text:
Jaheira deck only. Uses (3 charges).
[free] Exhaust Khalid's Gift and spend 1 charge: Choose an asset you control. Trigger an ability on that asset ignoring up to 1 of its [action] costs. Before triggering the ability, you may replenish 1 use on that asset.

cards.name: Bad Intel
cards.text: Revelation - Put Bad Intel into play in your threat play area and take 1 damage. Forced - After you discover 1 or more clues: Shuffle Bad Intel into your deck. [action][action]: Discard Bad Intel.

cards.back_flavor: Astarion prowled the night as a vampire spawn for centuries, serving a sadistic master until a mind flayer parasite freed him from his bonds. Now that he can walk in daylight the game is on, for only his old master stands in the way of him becoming the greatest vampire the world has ever known.
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Rogue cards ([rogue]) level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, up to 5 other events level 0-2*. For every 10 experience you've earned in total, increase this level* by 1. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Exsanguinate, Sanguine Servitude, 1 random basic weakness.
cards.flavor: "This is a gift; I won't forget it."
cards.name: Astarion
cards.text:
[reaction] After you evade an enemy: Move 1 damage from Astarion to that enemy. (Limit once per round.)
[elder_sign] effect: +2. Search your deck and discard pile for Exsanguinate and add it to your hand.

cards.name: Exsanguinate
cards.text:
Astarion deck only.
Fast. Play after you move damage from a card you control to an enemy.
You get +1 to each of your skills for the remainder of the round. Attach Exsanguinate to that enemy. Reduce the difficulty of tests on or against attached enemy by 1.
[reaction] When attached enemy is defeated: Shuffle Exsanguinate into Astarion's deck.

cards.name: Sanguine Servitude
cards.text: Revelation - Put Sanguine Servitude into play in your threat area. Forced - When you deal or move damage to an enemy: Reveal a random token from the chaos bag. If it is a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] token, deal or move that damage to an [[Ally]] asset or investigator at your location instead. Then, you may take 2 horror to discard this card.

cards.back_flavor: Minsc is a Rashemaar berserker aided by his trusted companion, Boo. As a young man, he teamed up with a band of travelers including Jaheira and Gorion's Ward to defeat Sarevok during the Iron Crisis. A century later, Minsc and Jaheira reunited to uncover the mysterious Cult of the Absolute. In his haste, Minsc was captured and brainwashed. Through the efforts of Jaheira and her new allies, Minsc was rescued. Now, he walks the road of redemption hoping to right the wrongs of his past.
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Rogue cards ([rogue]) level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, up to 10 other skills level 0-1*. For every 10 experience you've earned in total, increase this level* by 1. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Boo, Stone Lord, 1 random basic weakness.
cards.name: Minsc
cards.text:
You begin the game with Boo in play.
[reaction] After you succeed at a skill test by 2 or more: Gain 1 resource.
[elder_sign] effect: +1. After this test ends, ready Boo.

cards.name: Boo
cards.text:
Fast. Minsc deck only.
[reaction] When you would succeed at a skill test, exhaust Boo: Commit an eligible card from your hand and draw 1 card.
[reaction] When Boo leaves play, move all damage and horror from Boo to Minsc: Return Boo to your hand.

cards.name: Stone Lord
cards.text:
While Stone Lord is in your hand, you get -1 to each your skills.
This skill's icons subtract from your skill value instead of adding to it.
If this skill test fails, exhaust all of your assets and you cannot ready your assets this round.

cards.back_flavor: A loyal cleric of Shar, Shadowheart is the sole survivor of a holy mission undertaken on the Mistress of the Night’s behest. She alone must deliver a relic of immense power to her coven in Baldur’s Gate, while threatened by a strange new magic that is burgeoning from within.
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Mystic cards ([mystic]) level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, up to 10 other [[Insight]] and/or [[Trick]] cards level 0-2*. For every 10 experience you've earned in total, increase this level* by 1. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Mysterious Mission, Nightsong, Shar's Teachings, 1 random basic weakness.
cards.name: Shadowheart
cards.text:
For each shroud token on your location, increase its shroud value by 1.
For each shroud token on your location, reduce the difficulty of tests on/against treacheries and enemies at your location by 1.
[elder_sign] effect: +1. If there is a shroud token on your location, you automatically succeed, instead.

cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Mystic cards ([mystic]) level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, up to 10 other [[Insight]] and/or [[Trick]] cards level 0-2*. For every 10 experience you've earned in total, increase this level* by 1. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Mysterious Mission, Dame Aylin, Shar's Teachings, 1 random basic weakness. Additional Restrictions: Replace Nightsong with Dame Aylin. Unlock: You may only play this investigator if there are 3 or more tally marks in your Campaign Log recorded next to "Shadowheart recovered a memory". Transfer all experience, cards, story rewards, and trauma from Shadowheart (The Daughter of Darkness) to this investigator.
cards.flavor: "You can't cast a shadow without some light."
cards.name: Shadowheart
cards.text:
For each shroud token on your location, reduce its shroud value by 1.
[elder_sign] effect: +1. If there is a shroud token on your location, you automatically succeed, instead.

cards.name: Mysterious Mission
cards.text:
Shadowheart deck only. Permanent.
[reaction] After you discover 1 or more clues from any location: Place 1 resource on that location, as a shroud token.
[free] Exhaust Mysterious Mission: Shuffle Nightsong from your discard pile into your deck.

cards.name: Nightsong
cards.text: Aloof. Treat Nightsong's location as if it has no shroud tokens. [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] (4). If you succeed, discard Nightsong and record in your Campaign Log that "Shadowheart recovered a memory." Next to this, in parentheses, record 1 tally mark. Forced - After Shadowheart defeats Nightsong: Remove Nightsong from your deck for the rest of the campaign. Add Shar's Spear of Evening to your deck and add it to your hand. It does not count towards your deck size.

cards.name: Dame Aylin
cards.text: Shadowheart (Forged Her Own Path) deck only. [free] Exhaust Dame Aylin and remove up to 3 shroud tokens from your location: Choose an investigator at your location. They search the top X cards of their deck for a card, draw it, and shuffle their deck. X is thrice the number of shroud tokens removed.

cards.name: Shar's Spear of Evening
cards.text: Shadowheart (Daughter of Darkness) deck only. [free] Exhaust Shar's Spear of Evening: Add your location's shroud value to your skill value for this test. [action]: Fight. You get +2 [combat] and deal +1 damage for this attack (+2 damage instead if there are 1 or more shroud tokens on your location).

cards.name: Shar's Teachings
cards.text: Revelation - Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw that many cards. Draw 1 fewer card for every shroud token on your location and connecting locations (to a maximum of 3 fewer cards). If the same number of cards were drawn by this effect, shuffle this card into your deck.

cards.back_flavor: Noble by birth, Wyll made his name as the heroic 'Blade of Frontiers'. But to become a living legend, he struck a bargain with a devil, a bargain from which he longs to break free before it consumes his soul for good.
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Mystic cards ([mystic]) level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, up to 10 other [[Weapon]] cards level 0-2*. For every 10 experience you've earned in total, increase this level* by 1. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Pact of the Blade, Mizora, 1 random basic weakness.
cards.name: Wyll
cards.text: [reaction] After you play or activate an [action] ability on a [[Spell]] card: Play or activate an [action] ability on a [[Weapon]] card you control (without paying its [action] cost), or vice versa. (Limit once per round.) [elder_sign] effect: +2. Until the end of the round, increase the limit on the above [reaction] ability by 1.

cards.name: Pact of the Blade
cards.text:
Wyll deck only.
Attach to a [[Weapon]] asset you control.
While resolving a triggered ability on attached asset, you get +2 to each of your skills.
Attached asset gains: "[action] Exhaust this asset: Search the top 9 cards of your deck for a [[Pact]] card and draw it. Shuffle your deck."

cards.name: Mizora
cards.text: Aloof. Hunter. Forced - At the end of the mythos phase: Place 1 doom on Mizora. Forced - After Mizora is defeated: Wyll suffers 1 physical trauma or 1 mental trauma. [action]: Parley. Test (3) [willpower] or [intellect]. If you succeed, place 1 horror on Mizora. If there are 2 or more horror on her, discard her.

cards.back_flavor: Fresh-escaped from Hell, Karlach is finally free of the archdevil Zariel -- but not from the infernal engine Zariel planted in her chest. With her first taste of freedom in ten years, Karlach is eager to find a fix for the engine that’s burning hotter and hotter before it burns her out completely. But even more premier in her mind? Exploring, falling in love, and taking revenge on the man who sold her to Zariel all those years ago.
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Survivor cards ([survivor]) level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, up to 10 other [[Tactic]] and/or [[Spirit]] cards level 0-2*. For every 10 experience you've earned in total, increase this level* by 1. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Infernal Engine, 2 copies of Infernal Iron, Numbered, 1 random basic weakness. Additional Requirements: You begin the game with Infernal Engine (Heart of Fire) side faceup.
cards.name: Karlach
cards.text: Forced - After you deal damage to an enemy with an attack: Place 1 damage on Infernal Engine, as heat. [reaction] After you take damage: Move 1 of that damage from Karlach to Infernal Engine. [elder_sign] effect: +1 for each heat on Infernal Engine. You may place or remove 2 heat on it.

cards.name: Infernal Engine
cards.text: Ignite. Karlach deck only. Permanent. [reaction] After an enemy engages you, if Infernal Engine has 3 or more heat on it: Deal 1 damage to that enemy. Forced - If Infernal Engine has 6 or more heat on it: Flip it over.

cards.name: Infernal Engine
cards.text: Karlach deck only. Permanent. You cannot trigger Karlach's [reaction] ability. Change Karlach's Forced ability from "place 1 damage on Infernal Engine, as heat" to "move 1 heat from Infernal Engine to Karlach, as damage. If Infernal Engine has 3 or fewer heat on it, flip it over."

cards.name: Infernal Iron
cards.text:
Karlach deck only.
Fast. Play during any [free] player window.
Attach this card to Infernal Engine. Remove half of the heat from it (rounded up) and flip it over to its [[Spirit]] side.

cards.name: Numbered
cards.text: Revelation - Put Numbered into play in your threat area. Forced - After your turn ends, if Infernal Engine is on its [[Injury]] side faceup: Place 1 damage here. Forced - When the game ends, if there are 4 or more damage here: You suffer 1 physical trauma.

cards.back_flavor: A life of experiences, from the enslaved consort of the drow of the Underdark, to the Archdruid of the Emerald Grove, Halsin never lost his gentle and honest demeanor. Though a powerful healer with a lofty title, Halsin preferred to explore the wilds and be one with nature. Since Ketheric Thorm's corruption of his beloved forests, he seeks to relinquish the curse's grip on the land.
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Survivor cards ([survivor]) level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, [[Ritual]] cards level 0-2*. For every 10 experience you've earned in total, increase this level* by 1. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Healing the Land, Shadow Curse, 1 random basic weakness.
cards.name: Halsin
cards.text:
[reaction] After 1 or more cards are discarded from your hand or play area by a card cost or effect: Shuffle a different card from your discard pile into your deck. Draw 1 card. (Limit once per phase.)
[elder_sign] effect: +1. You may discard a card from your hand or play area.

cards.name: Healing the Land
cards.text:
Halsin deck only.
You have 2 additional arcane slots, which can only be used to hold [[Ritual]] assets.
[reaction] After an investigator at your locations fails at a skill test during a revelation ability, choose and discard a card from your hand: Cancel all effects of the failed test. That encounter card gains surge.

cards.name: Shadow Curse
cards.text: Revelation - Attach to your location. Attached location and each connecting location gets +1 shroud for each card beneath Shadow Curse. Forced - At the end of the round: Halsin places a random non-weakness card from his hand beneath Shadow Curse. [action][action]: Discard Shadow Curse.

cards.back_flavor: You awake inside a gargantuan illithid ship where mind flayers infect you with an illithid tadpole, a parasite that enthralls and transforms you into a mind flayer. The clock is ticking and you will soon be experiencing the first symptoms of your transformation. Your fate lies in your hands. What will you do?
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Secondary Class Choice: At deck creation, choose any [[Trait]] or Arkham class ([guardian], [seeker], [rogue], [mystic], or [survivor]). Deckbuilding Options: Guardian cards ([guardian]) level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, up to 10 other level 0-2 cards of your chosen [[Trait]] or Arkham class. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Illithid Potential, 2 random basic weaknesses.
cards.name: Tav
cards.text:
At deck creation, choose one --
- You may include up to 2 different cards with the Class keyword in your deck.
- Reduce the experience cost to upgrade a card with the Subclass keyword by 4.
[elder_sign] effect: +1. Draw 1 card and gain 1 resource.

cards.back_flavor: You awake inside a gargantuan illithid ship where mind flayers infect you with an illithid tadpole, a parasite that enthralls and transforms you into a mind flayer. The clock is ticking and you will soon be experiencing the first symptoms of your transformation. Your fate lies in your hands. What will you do?
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Secondary Class Choice: At deck creation, choose any [[Trait]] or Arkham class ([guardian], [seeker], [rogue], [mystic], or [survivor]). [elder_sign] effect: +1. Draw 1 card and gain 1 resource.

cards.text:
Gale deck only. Permanent.
[reaction] When you would test your [willpower], [combat], or [agility] on a [[Spell]] card: Test your [intellect] instead. All modifiers on that card modify your [intellect] instead.

- You may include up to 2 different cards with the Class keyword in your deck.
- Reduce the experience cost to upgrade a card with the Subclass keyword by 4.
[elder_sign] effect: +1. Draw 1 card and gain 1 resource.

cards.name: Barbarian
cards.text: Class. Permanent. Uses (2 rage). Barbarian enters play with 1 additional rage for every 10 experience you've earned in total. [free] Rage -- Exhaust Barbarian and spend 1 rage: You become "enraged" and get +2 skill value while attacking or resolving an ability on a treachery card. After your turn ends or after you fail a skill test, you are no longer enraged.

cards.name: Barbarian
cards.text: Subclass. Permanent. Barbarian enters play with 2 additional rage. [reaction] Frenzy -- While enraged, when you attack an enemy, if you have [advantage] or if a chaos token with a non-negative modifier is revealed during an attack: You deal an additional damage.

cards.name: Barbarian
cards.text: Subclass. Permanent. Animal Aspect -- When you purchase Barbarian, choose two aspects. Once per test (twice if enraged), a non-weakness card in your hand, deck, or play area gains an instance of each chosen aspect's skill icon until the end of that test. - Will of the Wolf ([willpower]) - Eye of the Eagle ([intellect]) - Brute of the Bear ([combat]) - Sprint of the Stallion ([agility])

cards.name: Barbarian
cards.text: Subclass. Permanent. Forced - Wild Magic Surge -- When you Rage: Shuffle cards bonded to Barbarian and draw 1 at random. Forced - When a card bonded to Barbarian leaves play, or if you are no longer enraged: Set it aside, out of play.

cards.name: Weapon Infusion
cards.text: Bonded (Barbarian). Wild Magic only. Revelation - Put Weapon Infusion into play in your play area. [[Weapon]] assets you control gain the [[Relic]] trait. You get +1 skill value and deal +1 damage during attacks on these assets.

cards.name: Bolt of Light
cards.text: Bonded (Barbarian). Wild Magic only. Revelation - Put Bolt of Light into play in your play area. Discover 1 clue at your location. [reaction] After you succeed a skill test by X or more, where X is the shroud value of a location up to 1 connection away, exhaust Bolt of Light: Discover 1 clue at that location.

cards.name: Teleport
cards.text: Bonded (Barbarian). Wild Magic only. Revelation - Put Teleport into play in your play area. Your move actions do not trigger attacks of opportunity. You may move to any revealed location as if it is connected to your location. Anytime you move, you may disengage all enemies engaged with you.

cards.name: Dark Tendrils
cards.text: Bonded (Barbarian). Wild Magic only. Revelation - Put Dark Tendrils into play in your play area. [reaction] When you deal damage to an enemy: Gain 1 resource or exhaust that enemy.

cards.name: Intangible Spirit
cards.text: Bonded (Barbarian). Wild Magic only. Revelation - Put Intangible Spirit into play in your play area. Heal 1 damage and 1 horror. [reaction] After you defeat, evade, or discard an enemy, exhaust Intangible Spirit: Place 1 rage on Barbarian.

cards.name: Bard
cards.text: Class. Permanent. [free] Bardic Inspiration -- During a skill test performed by another investigator at your location or a connecting location, place a non-weakness card from your hand on top of your deck: They get +1 skill value for this test. If they succeed, draw the top or bottom card of your deck. (Limit once for each investigator per round.)

cards.name: Bard
cards.text: Subclass. Permanent. You may reduce the test difficulty by 1 instead of giving +1 skill value for Bardic Inspiration. You may exhaust Bard to reduce the difficulty an additional time. Magical Secrets -- You may include up to 2 non-Bard class specific cards in your deck, ignoring its "class deck only" text.

cards.name: Bard
cards.text: Subclass. Permanent. Slashing Flourish -- You may trigger Bardic Inspiration for attacks and evasion attempts you perform. If you do, you get an additional +1 skill value. If you succeed, deal 1 damage to that enemy.

cards.name: Bard
cards.text: Subclass. Permanent. You may place a card on the bottom of your deck instead of on top of your deck for Bardic Inspiration. [reaction] Combat Inspiration -- After you trigger Bardic Inspiration: The performing investigator gets [advantage] for this test and gains 1 resource.

cards.name: Cleric
cards.text: Class. Permanent. Uses (2 divinity). Cleric enters play with 1 additional divinity for every 10 experience you've earned in total. [action] Turn Undead -- Spend 1 divinity: Parley. Move a non-[[Elite]] enemy from your location to a connecting location. Enemies moved by this effect cannot move for the remainder of the round.

cards.name: Cleric
cards.text: Subclass. Permanent. [reaction] Blessings of Knowledge -- After the last clue is discovered from your location: Draw 1 card. (Limit once per game at each location.) [reaction] Knowledge of the Ages -- When an investigator at your location discovers 1 or more clues, exhaust Cleric and spend 1 divinity: They discover 1 additional clue.

cards.name: Cleric
cards.text: Subclass. Permanent. [reaction] Disciple of Life -- After one of your card effects heals damage and/or horror from a card: The healed card's controller gains 1 resource. [action] Preserve Life -- Spend 1 divinity: Heal a combined 3 damage and/or horror from among player cards at your location and connecting locations.

cards.name: Cleric
cards.text: Subclass. Permanent. [reaction] Radiance of the Dawn -- After one of your card effects cancels an attack or damage/horror: Choose an investigator to get [advantage] on their next skill test. [reaction] Warding Flare -- When an investigator would be dealt damage and/or horror, spend 1 divinity: Cancel up to 2 damage and/or horror dealt.

cards.name: Cleric
cards.text: Subclass. Permanent. [reaction] War Priest -- After you ready a card during an investigator's turn, exhaust Cleric: That investigator may take an additional action during their turn, which can only be used to fight. [free] Guided Strike -- Spend 1 divinity: Ready an asset at your location.

cards.name: Druid
cards.text: Class. Permanent. Uses (2 charges). Druid enters play with 1 additional charge for every 10 experience you've earned in total. [action] Wild Shape -- Exhaust Druid and spend 1 charge: Put 1 set-aside bonded asset into play. When it leaves play, set it aside. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

cards.name: Druid
cards.text: Subclass. Permanent. Nature's Ward -- While you control a Wild Shape asset, do not perform [concentration] tests when you take damage/horror. [action] Land's Stride -- Exhaust Druid: Parley. Attach a player card attached to your location to a connecting location, or vice versa. As it attaches, you may move to that location as well.

cards.name: Druid
cards.text: Subclass. Permanent. Wild Shape assets only set base skill values higher than your base skill values. [reaction] Fungal Infestation -- When a card at your location is defeated or discarded, exhaust Druid: Move 1 damage or 1 horror from that card to another card at your location as damage. (It is still defeated or discarded.)

cards.name: Druid
cards.text: Subclass. Permanent. Lunar Mend -- Increase your druid level by 1. When you trigger Wild Shape, you may put into play assets that say "Moon only." Wild Shape's [action] ability is now a [free] ability.

cards.name: Cat
cards.text:
Wild Shape. Bonded (Druid).
Set your base skill values to [willpower] 2 | [intellect] 4 | [combat] 2 | [agility] 4.
You cannot take non-basic actions.
[free] Discard Cat: Automatically evade a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location.

cards.name: Spider
cards.text: Wild Shape. Bonded (Druid). Set your base skill values to [willpower] 4 | [intellect] 2 | [combat] 3 | [agility] 3. [reaction] Web -- After you perform a successful attack or evasion attempt against a non-[[Elite]] enemy, exhaust Spider: That enemy cannot move or make attacks of opportunity for the remainder of the round.

cards.name: Wolf
cards.text: Wild Shape. Bonded (Druid). Set your base skill values to [willpower] 2 | [intellect] 2 | [combat] 4 | [agility] 4. [reaction] Inciting Howl -- After an investigator moves from or to your location, exhaust Wolf: That investigator moves to a connecting location from their current location.

cards.name: Bear
cards.text: Wild Shape. Bonded (Druid). Set your base skill values to [willpower] 2 | [intellect] 2 | [combat] 5 | [agility] 3. [action] Claws -- Exhaust Bear: Fight. You deal +1 damage for this attack. [free] Choose and discard a card from your hand: Ready Bear. (Limit once per round.)

cards.name: Badger
cards.text: Wild Shape. Bonded (Druid). Set your base skill values to [willpower] 3 | [intellect] 4 | [combat] 3 | [agility] 2. [free] Burrow -- Exhaust Badger: Choose a card in any investigator's discard pile. Shuffle it into their deck. Then, they gain 1 resource.

cards.name: Deep Rothé
cards.text: Wild Shape. Bonded (Druid). Set your base skill values to [willpower] 4 | [intellect] 2 | [combat] 4 | [agility] 2. [free] Dancing Lights -- Exhaust Deep Rothé: The performing investigator gets [advantage] for this test.

cards.name: Dire Raven
cards.text:
Wild Shape. Bonded (Druid). Moon only.
Set your base skill values to [willpower] 3 | [intellect] 4 | [combat] 1 | [agility] 4.
[free] Exhaust Dire Raven and deal 1 horror to it: Discover 1 clue at any location. Then, you may move to that location.

cards.name: Sabre-Toothed Tiger
cards.text: Wild Shape. Bonded (Druid). Moon only. Set your base skill values to [willpower] 3 | [intellect] 1 | [combat] 5 | [agility] 3. [action] Pounce -- Exhaust Sabre-Toothed Tiger: Move. Choose an enemy at a connecting location. Move to its location and take a fight action against that enemy. If you successfully attack that enemy, exhaust it and deal +1 damage.

cards.name: Elemental
cards.text: Wild Shape. Bonded (Druid). Set your base skill values to [willpower] 4 | [intellect] 4 | [combat] 1 | [agility] 3. You can have up to 2 [concentration] cards in play. [reaction] After you play a card with the concentration keyword: Heal 1 damage or 1 horror from Elemental.

cards.name: Owlbear
cards.text:
Wild Shape. Bonded (Druid).
Set your base skill values to [willpower] 4 | [intellect] 1 | [combat] 5 | [agility] 2.
[free] Exhaust Owlbear: Engage an enemy at your location. That enemy attacks you.
[reaction] When an enemy attack deals damage and/or horror to Owlbear: Deal that much damage and horror as damage to the attacking enemy.

cards.name: Displacer Beast
cards.text: Wild Shape. Bonded (Druid). Forced - After your turn begins: Set 2 of your base skill values to 5 and the rest to 1. [reaction] When you would exhaust a card you control: Instead, exhaust Displacer Beast. Costs that exhaust a card are considered paid.

cards.name: Fighter
cards.text: Class. Permanent. Forced - When your first turn of the game begins: Place 1 damage on it. For every 10 experience you've earned in total, place 1 additional damage on it. [free] Action Surge -- Exhaust Fighter and remove 1 damage from it: You may take an additional action during your turn this round.

cards.customization_change:
- Discard from play a treachery at that enemy's location (or not at any location) that is not attached to an <t>Elite</t> enemy.
- Reduce the difficulty of attacks, parleys, and evasion attempts other investigators perform this round against that enemy by 2.
- Disengage it from each investigator. Choose an investigator at its location to move to a connecting location.
- That enemy deals 1 fewer damage or horror until it leaves play.
- After this attack ends, you get +1 skill value and deal +1 damage the next time you attack that enemy.
- If that enemy is non-<t>Elite</t>, move it to a connecting location.
- Deal half of this attack's damage to another enemy at this location (rounded up).
- Exhaust that enemy.
cards.customization_text: □ Disarming Attack. Discard from play a treachery at that enemy's location (or not at any location) that is not attached to an Elite enemy. □ Distracting Attack. Reduce the difficulty of attacks, parleys, and evasion attempts other investigators perform this round against that enemy by 2. □ Maneuvering Attack. Disengage it from each investigator. Choose an investigator at its location to move to a connecting location. □ Menacing Attack. That enemy deals 1 fewer damage or horror until it leaves play. □ Precision Attack. After this attack ends, you get +1 skill value and deal +1 damage the next time you attack that enemy. □ Pushing Attack. If that enemy is non-Elite, move it to a connecting location. □ Sweeping Attack. Deal half of this attack's damage to another enemy at this location (rounded up). □ Trip Attack. Exhaust that enemy.
cards.name: Fighter
cards.text: Customizable. Subclass. Permanent. Uses (4 superiority.) Replenish 1 superiority when you Action Surge. When you purchase Fighter, mark four checkboxes on Battle Master's upgrade sheet. [reaction] Battle Manoeuvers -- After you successfully attack an enemy, spend 1 superiority: Choose a marked checkbox ability to resolve.

cards.name: Fighter
cards.text: Subclass. Permanent. [reaction] Weapon Bond -- Before you draw your opening hand: Search your deck for a [[Weapon]] asset and play it, at -2 cost. You get +1 skill value during skill tests on [[Weapon]] assets.

cards.name: Fighter
cards.text: Subclass. Permanent. Improved Critical Hit -- Anytime you reveal a "+1" token, you may choose to treat it as an [elder_sign] token. [elder_sign] effect: You automatically succeed. Draw 1 card and gain 1 resource. If this test is during an attack, that attack deals +1 damage. You may instead resolve this effect anytime you would resolve your normal [elder_sign] effect.

cards.name: Monk
cards.text: Class. Permanent. Uses (2 ki). Monk enters play with 1 additional ki for every 10 experience you've earned in total. Your basic actions are considered "unarmed". You may treat your unarmed attacks as if you are fighting with a [[Melee]] asset. [reaction] Flurry of Blows -- After you take an unarmed action, exhaust Monk and spend 1 ki: Take an unarmed action.

cards.name: Monk
cards.text: Subclass. Permanent. Disciple of the Elements -- Your Monk cards are considered all 5 classes for the purposes of card effects. [reaction] After a skill test during an unarmed action ends: Place a skill card you committed to that test at the bottom of your deck instead of discarding it. Draw 1 card. (Limit once per round.)

cards.name: Monk
cards.text: Subclass. Permanent. Ki Resonation -- While you have committed 1 or more skill cards to your unarmed fight actions, your attacks deal an additional damage. [reaction] Wholeness of Body -- After you are healed damage and/or horror: Place 1 ki on Monk and ready it. (Limit once per round.)

cards.name: Monk
cards.text: Subclass. Permanent. Monk enters play with 2 additional ki. [action]: Shadow Arts -- Search the encounter discard pile and your bonded cards for 1 copy of Shadow Step and shuffle it into the encounter deck. This action is considered "unarmed". (Limit once per round.)

cards.name: Paladin
cards.text: Class. Permanent. Divine Sense -- During setup, add 2 [bless] tokens to the chaos bag. For every 10 experience you've earned in total, add 1 additional [bless] token (to a max of 4 total tokens added). For each [bless] token in excess of this max, gain 1 resource instead. Lay on Hands -- Once per campaign, you may ignore 1 physical or mental trauma you would suffer.

cards.name: Paladin
cards.text: Subclass. Permanent. Oath -- You must choose yourself or your location for the purposes of effects and keywords on encounter cards (including hunter, enemies engaging), if able. [reaction] Aura of Warding -- After a card you own adds 1 or more [bless] tokens to the chaos bag: Gain 1 resource, or heal 1 damage or 1 horror.

cards.name: Paladin
cards.text: Subclass. Permanent. Oath -- You must defeat enemies in the threat areas of other investigators at your location before yours. [reaction] Holy Rebuke -- When an investigator reveals a non-[auto_fail] token, exhaust Paladin: Search the token pool or chaos bag for a [bless] token and reveal it, instead (returning the other token to the chaos bag).

cards.name: Paladin
cards.text: Subclass. Permanent. Oath -- You must not evade, take/perform evade actions, or discard enemies by player card effect. [reaction] Inquisitor's Might -- When you reveal a [elder_sign] or [bless] token, exhaust Paladin: Deal 1 damage to an enemy at your location.

cards.name: Paladin
cards.text: Subclass. Permanent. Your Divine Sense adds [curse] tokens instead of [bless] tokens. Divine Smite is now also a [rogue] card with the [[Cursed]] trait. Instead of adding [bless] tokens, add [curse] tokens. Spiteful Suffering -- Treat the modifier on [curse] tokens you reveal as "0."

cards.name: Ranger
cards.text: Class. Permanent. [free] Natural Explorer -- Exhaust Ranger: Look at the revealed side of a connecting unrevealed location. [reaction] After you reveal a location or put a new location into play, exhaust Ranger: Gain 1 resource.

cards.name: Ranger
cards.text: Subclass. Permanent. You get +1 [intellect]. You may target an enemy with 1 or more bounties on it at a connecting location for [[Firearm]] or [[Ranged]] attacks. Ignore the aloof and retaliate keywords on that enemy. [free] Hunter's Prey -- Choose an enemy in play: Place 1 resource on it, as a bounty. (Limit once per round.)

cards.name: Ranger
cards.text: Subclass. Permanent. You get +1 [combat]. [reaction] Companion's Bond -- At the end of your turn: Place a trust token on 2 [[Creature]] assets you control. Your investigator's Deckbuilding Options gain: "[[Creature]] cards level 0-5."

cards.name: Ranger
cards.text: Subclass. Permanent. You get +1 [agility]. [reaction] Dread Ambusher -- After your turn begins, if no actions have been completed this phase and there are no enemies at your location with an evade value higher than your [agility]: Take an action. You get [advantage] during this action.

cards.name: Rogue
cards.text: Class. Permanent. [reaction] Sneak Attack -- After damage is dealt to or moved to an enemy at your location not engaged with you: Deal 1 damage to that enemy. (Limit once per round.)

cards.name: Rogue
cards.text: Subclass. Permanent. Reduce the cost of fast cards you play by 1. Fast Hands -- You may take an additional action during your turn, which can only be used to move, evade, or activate [[Illicit]] [action] abilities.

cards.name: Rogue
cards.text: Subclass. Permanent. [reaction] When your turn begins: Search your bonded cards for Mage Hand Legerdemain and draw it. [reaction] Magical Ambush -- After an enemy readies at your location, exhaust Rogue: Shuffle a [[Trick]] card from your discard pile into your deck.

cards.name: Rogue
cards.text: Subclass. Permanent. During your skill tests, you get +1 skill value for each enemy at your location not engaged with you. [reaction] Assassin's Alacrity -- After you defeat an enemy, if you are not engaged with any enemies: Draw 1 card and gain 1 resource.

cards.name: Sorcerer
cards.text: Class. Permanent. Uses (3 charges). Sorcerer enters play with 1 additional charge for every 10 experience you've earned in total. [reaction] Twinned/Quickened Spell -- When you play a [[Spell]] card, exhaust Sorcerer and spend 2 charges from assets you control: That card gains fast or resolve its effects an additional time.

cards.name: Sorcerer
cards.text: Subclass. Permanent. Storm's Fury -- You may play cards with "conjuration skill tests" from your discard pile. If you do, shuffle them into your deck instead of discarding them. [reaction] Tempestuous Magic -- After you play or resolve an ability on a [[Spell]] card: Move to a connecting location. (Limit once per round.)

cards.name: Sorcerer
cards.text: Subclass. Permanent. Draconic Ancestry -- When you purchase Sorcerer, choose any [[Trait]]. Swap any number of level 0 cards out of your deck in exchange for that many level 0 cards. Your investigator's Deckbuilding Options gain: "Up to 10 other level 0-3 cards of your chosen [[Trait]]."

cards.name: Sorcerer
cards.text: Subclass. Permanent. Forced - Wild Magic Surge -- After you play a [[Spell]] card: Place 2 horror tokens here. Reveal X random non-[bless]/[curse]/ chaos tokens from the chaos bag. X is the amount of horror here. If you reveal an [elder_sign] or [skull] token, remove all horror tokens and draw a random bonded card.

cards.name: Explosive Healing
cards.text: Bonded (Sorcerer). Wild Magic only. Revelation - Put Explosive Healing into play in your play area. Heal 3 damage or 3 horror (or any combination thereof) from among investigators and/or [[Ally]] assets at your location. Forced - At the end of the round: Set Explosive Healing aside, out of play.

cards.name: Polymorphed Sheep
cards.text: Bonded (Sorcerer). Wild Magic only. Revelation - Put Polymorphed Sheep into play in your play area. Treat your investigator as if their printed text box were blank (except for [[Traits]]). Set the base value of each of your skills to 2. Forced - At the end of the round: Set Polymorphed Sheep aside, out of play.

cards.name: Sorcery Surplus
cards.text: Bonded (Sorcerer). Wild Magic only. Revelation - Put Sorcery Surplus into play in your play area. Place 2 charges on Sorcerer. Place 2 charges on an asset you control. Forced - At the end of the round: Set Sorcery Surplus aside, out of play.

cards.name: Summoned Djinni
cards.text: Bonded (Sorcerer). Wild Magic only. Revelation - Put Summoned Djinni into play in your play area. Up to thrice this round, when an investigator initiates a skill test, that investigator gets [advantage] for that test. Forced - At the end of the round: Set Summoned Djinni aside, out of play.

cards.name: Turn Magic
cards.text: Bonded (Sorcerer). Wild Magic only. Revelation - Put Turn Magic into play in your play area and attach a random asset from your collection (Banishment, Telekinesis, Freedom of Movement, Daylight). It does not take up any slots or [concentration]. Return it to the collection when it leaves play. Forced - At the end of the round: Set Turn Magic aside, out of play.

You get +2 skill value and deal an additional damage with Eldritch Blast.
You have an additional hand slot, which can only be used to hold a <t>Tome</t> asset.
Reduce the difficulty of skill tests you perform during 'parley' actions by 2. (This effect does not stack with Fine Clothes.)
When you initiate a skill test, you may set your location's shroud value to 3 for the this test.
You get +1 health and +1 sanity.

After you deal damage to a non-<t>Elite</t> enemy with Eldritch Blast, you may move it to a connecting location.
You get +X skill value during evasion attempts. X is your location's shroud value.

cards.name: Warlock
cards.text: Class. Customizable. Permanent. When you purchase Warlock, add 2 copies of Eldritch Blast to your deck, ignoring deckbuilding options. These do not count towards your deck size. You begin each game with 1 copy of Eldritch Blast as an additional card in your opening hand. Eldritch Invocation -- Mark a checkbox on Warlock's upgrade sheet for every 10 experience you've earned in total.

cards.name: Warlock
cards.text: Subclass. Permanent. When you purchase Warlock, mark two checkboxes on Warlock's upgrade sheet. [reaction] Entropic Ward -- When you reveal a non-[auto_fail] symbol token, place 1 doom on a card you control: Treat its modifier as 0.

cards.name: Warlock
cards.text: Subclass. Permanent. When you purchase Warlock, mark two checkboxes on Warlock's upgrade sheet. [free] Fey Presence -- Exhaust Warlock: Your next action gains the Parley action designator.

cards.name: Warlock
cards.text: Subclass. Permanent. When you purchase Warlock, mark two checkboxes on Warlock's upgrade sheet. [reaction] Dark One's Blessing -- When you discard a [[Spell]] card, exhaust Warlock: Shuffle it into your deck instead.

cards.name: Wizard
cards.text: Class. Permanent. Uses (2 charges). Wizard enters play with 1 additional charge for every 10 experience you've earned in total. [free] Arcane Recovery -- Exhaust Wizard: Move 1 charge from Wizard to an asset you control, as a secret or charge. You get +1 skill value for your next skill test.

cards.name: Wizard
cards.text: Subclass. Permanent. [reaction] Grim Harvest -- After an asset you control is discarded by a card effect or is defeated: Put it into play with at most 1 remaining health and sanity. At the end of the round, if it is still in play, discard it. (Limit once per round.)

cards.name: Wizard
cards.text: Subclass. Permanent. [reaction] Arcane Ward -- When you discard a [[Spell]] card you played or committed, attach it facedown to Wizard. [reaction] When you are dealt damage and/or horror: Discard up to 2 cards attached to Wizard to cancel that much damage and/or horror dealt. (Limit once per round.)

cards.name: Wizard
cards.text: Subclass. Permanent. [reaction] Portent -- At the start of the round, reveal a random chaos token from the chaos bag: Until the end of the round, that token is your "portent". [reaction] When a chaos token would be revealed from the chaos bag at your location: Search the chaos bag for your portent and reveal it, instead. (Limit once per round.)

cards.name: Wizard
cards.text: Subclass. Permanent. You have 2 additional arcane slots. Sculpt Spells -- Reduce all damage taken by investigators via your [[Spell]] card effects to 0 (including failed attacks). [free]: Place 1 damage on your location or a connecting location as a flammable token. (Limit once per round.)

cards.name: Cleric
cards.text: Subclass. Permanent. Acolyte of Nature -- You may take an additional action during your turn, which can only be used to play [[Ritual]] cards or activate [action] abilities on them. [free] Dampen Elements -- Exhaust Cleric and spend 1 divinity: Reduce the cost of the next [[Ritual]] asset you play by 3. It enters play with 2 additional uses.

cards.name: Cleric
cards.text: Subclass. Permanent. [free] Wrath of the Storm -- Return a total of 2 [bless] tokens to the token pool from the chaos bag or sealed on cards in play: Place 1 divinity on Cleric. [free] Destructive Wrath -- During a skill test you are performing, spend 1 divinity: Do not reveal chaos tokens for this test.

cards.name: Cleric
cards.text: Subclass. Permanent. X is your location's shroud. [reaction] Blessing of the Trickster -- When your turn begins: Search the top X cards of your deck for a [[Trick]] card and draw it. Shuffle your deck. [reaction] Invoke Duplicity -- After you play a [[Trick]] card, exhaust Cleric and spend 1 divinity: Discover clues at your location equal to half of X (rounded down).

cards.name: Wizard
cards.text: Subclass. Permanent. Minor Conjuration -- Once per round, you may treat a skill test you are performing as a conjuration skill test in addition to its skill type. [reaction] Benign Transposition -- After a card you control is exhausted: Ready another card you control. (Limit once per round.)

cards.name: Wizard
cards.text: Subclass. Permanent. Experimental Alchemy -- Tokens except damage, horror, clues, and doom are treated as interchangeable, universal tokens for the purposes of your card effects. [free]: Move a universal token from a card you control to another card you control. (Limit once per round.)

cards.name: Wizard
cards.text: Subclass. Permanent. Instinctive Charm -- You may test any skill of your choice for skill tests you perform during 'parley' actions. [reaction] Enchantment Savant -- After you parley or attach a card to an enemy: Discover 1 clue at any location. (Limit once per round.)

cards.name: Wizard
cards.text: Subclass. Permanent. Illusory Self -- You may take 2 additional mulligans. [free] Choose your location or a non-[[Elite]] enemy in play: Until the end of the round, while it is in play, swap your base [intellect] with its shroud, base [combat] with its fight, or base [agility] with its evade. (Limit once per round.)

cards.name: Mage Hand Legerdemain
cards.text: Bonded (Rogue). Arcane Trickster only. Fast. Play during any [free] player window. The next action you perform this round (except move or fight) may be performed as if you were at a revealed location up to 2 connections away. Forced - When this card would enter your discard pile or be shuffled into your deck, instead set it aside, out of play.

cards.name: Barbarian
cards.text: Subclass. Permanent. Giant's Rage -- While enraged, you may take actions, play cards, or trigger abilities at any revealed connecting location as if you were at that location. [reaction] After an enemy enters the victory display: Place 1 rage on Barbarian. (Limit once per round.)

cards.name: Bard
cards.text: Subclass. Permanent. [free] Mantle of Inspiration -- Exhaust Bard: Choose an investigator without a vigor card. They place the top card of their deck in their play area without looking at it, as a vigor card. Treat it as an asset with 1 health and 1 sanity. If it leaves play, they draw it.

cards.name: Cleric
cards.text: Subclass. Permanent. [free] Reaper -- Exhaust Cleric and add 2 [curse] tokens to the chaos bag: Place 2 divinity on Cleric. [reaction] Touch of Death -- After a [curse] token is revealed during a skill test, spend 1 divinity: Commit a card from your discard pile to that test.

cards.name: Druid
cards.text: Subclass. Permanent. Starry Form -- While you control a bonded "Stars only" asset, play with the top card of your deck revealed. Wild Shape's [action] ability is now a [free] ability while putting one of these bonded cards into play. [free]: Move the top card of your deck to the bottom. (Limit twice per round.)

cards.name: Archer
cards.text:
Wild Shape. Bonded (Druid). Stars only. Expire 2.
[free] Exhaust Archer: Test [willpower] or [agility] (X). X is the number of [willpower] and [agility] icons on the top card of your deck, not counting [wild] icons except on Druid cards. If you succeed, deal X damage to an enemy at your location.

cards.name: Chalice
cards.text:
Wild Shape. Bonded (Druid). Stars only. Expire 2.
[reaction] When one of your card effects heals damage and/or horror, exhaust Chalice: That effect heals 1 additional damage or horror for each [willpower] and [intellect] icon on the top card of your deck, not counting [wild] icons except on Druid cards. Draw 1 card.

cards.name: Dragon
cards.text: Wild Shape. Bonded (Druid). Stars only. Expire 2. Reduce the difficulty of your [concentration] tests by 2. [free] Exhaust Dragon: Reduce the difficulty of this test by X. X is the number of [willpower] and [combat] icons on the top card of your deck when you triggered this ability, not counting [wild] icons except on Druid cards.

cards.customization_change:
- If your modified skill value is equal to or greater than the attacked enemy's evade, shuffle that non-<t>Elite</t> enemy into its deck.
- If your modified skill value is equal to or greater than the attacked enemy's evade, discover 1 clue at your location.
- This attack deals no damage to investigators.
- The attacked enemy loses a keyword of your choice until it leaves play.
- If your modified skill value is equal to or greater than the attacked enemy's evade, that enemy cannot move or make attacks of opportunity this round.
- The card you are attacking with gains the <t>Spell</t> trait for the remainder of this round.
- Choose another enemy in play to be the target of this attack instead.
- The next time you perform a skill test on or against the attacked enemy, add your location's shroud value to your skill value.
cards.customization_text: □ Banishing Arrow. If your modified skill value is equal to or greater than the attacked enemy's evade, shuffle that non-Elite enemy into its deck. □ Beguiling Arrow. If your modified skill value is equal to or greater than the attacked enemy's evade, discover 1 clue at your location. □ Bursting Arrow. This attack deals no damage to investigators. □ Enfeebling Arrow. The attacked enemy loses a keyword of your choice until it leaves play. □ Grasping Arrow. cards.name: Fighter
cards.text: Customizable. Subclass. Permanent. When you purchase Fighter, mark four checkboxes on Arcane Archer's upgrade sheet. [reaction] Arcane Shot -- After revealing chaos tokens for an attack you are performing on a [[Firearm]] or [[Ranged]] card: Choose a marked checkbox ability to resolve. (Limit once per round.)

cards.name: Monk
cards.text: Subclass. Permanent. You get [disadvantage] on your skill tests. Intoxicating Strike -- Each icon on cards you committed that does not match the skill being tested reduces the difficulty of the test by 1. If you reduced the difficulty of a test to 0 this way, place 1 ki on Monk.

cards.name: Paladin
cards.text: Subclass. Permanent. Oath -- You must correct any rules mistakes that you notice during the game. [action] Divine Allegiance -- Return a total of X [bless] tokens to the token pool from the chaos bag or sealed on cards in play: Discover 2 clues at your location. X is its shroud.

cards.name: Ranger
cards.text: Subclass. Permanent. You get +1 [willpower]. [reaction] Gathered Swarm -- At the start of the round: Search your bonded cards for a bonded [[Swarm]] card and put them into play in your play area. When any of them would leave play, set it aside, out of play.

cards.name: Cloud of Jellyfish
cards.text:
Bonded (Ranger).
[free] Exhaust this card and detach it: Attach it to an asset in your play area with a cost of 1 or less.
Cloud of Jellyfish gains the text of the attached asset's textbox. Any self-referential text refers to Cloud of Jellyfish instead.

cards.name: Flurry of Moths
cards.text:
Bonded (Ranger).
[free] Exhaust this card and detach it: Attach it to an asset in your play area with a cost of 1 or less.
Increase all numeric values on attached asset by 1. This effect excludes test difficulty, costs, limits, and unknown values such as X.

cards.name: Legion of Bees
cards.text:
Bonded (Ranger).
[free] Exhaust this card and detach it: Attach it to an asset in your play area with a cost of 1 or less.
[reaction] After you spend or remove uses from attached: Place that many uses on it. (Limit once per round.)

cards.name: Rogue
cards.text: Subclass. Permanent. [reaction] Fancy Footwork -- When you deal or move damage to an enemy: Disengage with it. Until the end of the phase, that enemy cannot engage you. [reaction] Rakish Audacity -- After you resolve the effects on a [[Gambit]] or [[Tactic]] card, exhaust Rogue: Resolve its effects again.

cards.name: Sorcerer
cards.text: Subclass. Permanent. [action]: Search your bonded cards for Hound of Ill Omen and play it. When it leaves play, set it aside, out of play. Eyes of the Dark -- Effects increasing test difficulty or your location's shroud also increase your skill value.

cards.name: Hound of Ill Omen
cards.text:
Bonded (Sorcerer). Shadow Magic only.
While Hound of Ill Omen is exhausted, your location gets +1 shroud.
You may play [[Augury]] cards from your discard pile as if they were in your hand. As an additional cost to play a card this way, exhaust Hound of Ill Omen.

cards.name: Warlock
cards.text: Subclass. Permanent. When you purchase Warlock, mark two checkboxes on Warlock's upgrade sheet. [reaction] Hex Warrior -- At the start of your turn: Place 2 charges among [[Relic]] or [[Weapon]] assets you control.

cards.name: Wizard
cards.text: Subclass. Permanent. [reaction] When you activate an [action] ability you have already activated this round: You get [advantage] while resolving it. [reaction] Training in War and Song -- When you would reveal chaos tokens with [advantage]: Lose [advantage] for this test. After this test ends, take an action (Limit once per round.)

cards.name: Shadow Step
cards.text: Bonded (Monk). Shadow only. Revelation - Set Shadow Step aside, out of play. The owner of this card refers to the Shadow Step reference guide. Then, they disengage from each enemy engaged with them and may move to any revealed location.

cards.name: Reckless Attack
cards.text: Barbarian deck only. Fast. Play when you initiate an attack or evasion attempt. You get [advantage] for this skill test. Draw 1 card.

cards.name: Danger Sense
cards.text: Barbarian deck only. Fast. Play when an investigator at your location draws a non-weakness treachery card. Test [agility] (3). If you succeed, discover 2 clues at your location and that investigator gets [advantage] while resolving revelation abilities on that treachery card.

cards.name: Enraged Throw
cards.text: Berserker Barbarian deck only. Play only while enraged. Fight. You get +2 [combat] for this attack. If you succeed, deal damage equal to the attacked enemy's total damage and horror to another enemy at its location. If the attacked enemy is non-[[Elite]], you may move it to a connecting location before dealing this damage.

cards.name: Relentless Rage
cards.text: Barbarian deck only. Change the conditions of Rage from "After your turn ends or after you fail a skill test" to "After your turn ends during the next round." [reaction] After you fail a skill test: You get [advantage] on your next skill test this round.

cards.name: Feral Instinct
cards.text:
Barbarian deck only.
If this test is successful, for each different skill icon on Feral Instinct, draw 1 card. If this test fails, for each different skill icon on Feral Instinct, return a skill card not named Feral Instinct from your discard pile to your hand.

cards.name: Brutal Critical
cards.text:
Barbarian deck only.
While Brutal Critical is committed to a skill test during an attack you perform, your attack deals an additional damage for each [combat] on Brutal Critical.

cards.name: Vicious Mockery
cards.text: Bard deck only. Parley. Choose a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location. Test [willpower] or [agility] (2). If you succeed, deal 1 damage to that enemy and attach Vicious Mockery to it. Forced - When attached enemy would attack, move, or a forced ability on it would trigger, discard Vicious Mockery: Cancel that attack, move, or ability.

cards.name: Song of Rest
cards.text: Bard deck only. Exceptional. Parley. In player order, each investigator heals 1 damage or horror, and immediately takes an action as if it were their turn. [reaction] After you draw Song of Rest: Reveal it and draw 1 card. (Max once per round.)

cards.name: Jack of All Trades
cards.text:
Bard deck only. Myriad.
While this card is committed to a skill test you are performing, if all of your base skills are equal or if the skill being tested is not your highest skill, this card gains [wild][wild].
[reaction] After you draw Jack of All Trades: Reveal it and gain 1 resource. (Max once per round.)

cards.name: Anstruth Harp
cards.text: Bard deck only. Exceptional. [reaction] After you trigger Bardic Inspiration or parley: Place 1 charge on Anstruth Harp. [free] Spend 2 charges: Play a card or draw a card. [free] Spend 3 charges: Discover 1 clue at any location.

cards.name: Countercharm
cards.text:
Bard deck only.
Fast. Play when an investigator at any location initiates a skill test.
This test automatically succeeds. X is this test's difficulty.
[reaction] After you draw Countercharm: Reveal it and gain 1 resource. (Max once per round.)

cards.name: Font of Inspiration
cards.text: Bard deck only. Until the end of the round, change the limit on Bardic Inspiration from "once for each investigator per round" to "once per test". [reaction] After you draw Font of Inspiration: Play it, or reveal it and get +2 skill value for your next skill test this round. (Max once per round.)

cards.customization_change: You may choose 1 additional investigator. You may choose 1 additional investigator. Playing Bless does not provoke attacks of opportunity. You may choose investigators at connecting locations as well. For [concentration], you may test health or sanity. After Bless enters play, you may choose for it to take up a body slot instead of an arcane slot. Cleric and Paladin deck only. Customizable. [concentration] Sanity. Expire 3. Blessed adds 2 tokens instead of 1. If you cannot add any tokens to the chaos bag, the performing investigator gets [advantage] for this test.
cards.customization_text: □ Upcast. You may choose 1 additional investigator. □ Upcast. You may choose 1 additional investigator. □ Warden. For [concentration], you may test health or sanity. After Bless enters play, you may choose for it to take up a body slot instead of an arcane slot. □□ Holy Warrior.
